comment: I could rave on and on about Professor Santos. She is tough, and her Viticulture and Vinification course is a monster of a challenge. But if you love or are interested in wine, she will show you the ropes. She's incredibly knowledgeable and has a great sense of humor. Quizzes every class and fun tastings! If you can, get in a class with few people

Professor Santos is hands down one of the best professors I've had at KSU. She actually cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. If you are struggling, she is more than willing to help you in any way she can. This is an upper level class so it wasn't a piece of cake, but if you actually put in the effort and study, you can get an A.

She is very enthusiastic. You better prepare yourself though, you will be putting in some serious studying hours. I learned more in this class about a subject than any other class has taught me about their subject. I hope she keeps it just as difficult. Quiz and tasting every class. Loved it all!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Santos is  passionate, lectures are interesting, plus? We get to do tastings in this class. I swear, I learned more about history in this class than I have in any of my history classes. This isn't a blow off course, and it's not an easy A. Santos puts 'trick questions' to see if you really learned. Can get a C without the book, and A if you read

She is one of the worst professors I have had. She is moody, rude, and not flexible. The assignments were tough and her attitude makes it difficult to remain interested in class. She managed to make food tastings un-fun because of her extremely picky grading. Only take this class if you have no choice.

She is a very difficult proffesor who didn't teach much of the course at all, you just have to read the book. That being said she is an incredibly nice person! She also locks the door as soon as class starts and makes a big deal of electronics being used in class. I would not recommend.

A very interesting  and enjoyable course & I did not find Prof Santos to be anywhere near to horrible as many of these ratings indicate.  Go to class, submit all assignments, read, show interest in being there and you will do fine.  Her tests are difficult & she gets cranky with immature students, may want to bear this in mind as well.

Weigh the negative reviews carefully. Prof Santos is a very nice person & a good teacher.  A bit disorganized, much of that was due to circumstances beyond her control.  I do agree that she doesn't answer emails and often became frustrated with students.  As long as you read, submit journals, participate in & attend class it is not difficult.

This was the worst professor I have had since being a student at KSU!  I went to Professor Santos many times seeking help with the course and never received any assistance. She locks the door for students who are even seconds late, refuses to give study guides, refuses to put up powerpoint slides, and grades harshly without any guidance.

Avoid this professor if you can. She is very unorganized and unclear. Gets herself emotionally hyped up in class and ends up belittling her students. You can make an A if you try but you definately will NOT enjoy the class. There you have been warned!

She is unorganized, but she knows what she wants.  If you write down what she tells you to and pay attention in class, then you will get an A. Weekly journals are most important as they are not done in class, but through D2L.

Ophelia was a TERRIBLE professor... very confusing..didn't know what was going on half of the time and it was her class! She treated everyone like babies. I earned an 89.45 and she still gave me a B... very unfair DO NOT TAKE. In other words... AVOID!

Terrible and unorganized professor who is in way over her head. I wanted so badly to like her but she is simply impossible. Treats her class like children and is very condescending and emotional. Assignments and grading are very unclear. Took 2 months to grade papers and created an assignment on the last day of class the night before finals.

Definitely the worst professor I've ever had. As a CSH major it was VERY disapointing to have her for both of the intro classes. Doesn't grade anything until weeks and weeks later, horrible attitude, treats the class like they're highschoolers, very unclear about expectations, and DOES NOT take criticism well.

Ophelia is beyond rude. She treats her class like a middle school class and she will even take your phone up!!! She is unorganized and likes to start lecturing the class about their terrible behavior when in reality no one is doing anything wrong. She is ridiculous and i would avoid taking her.

I found her to be very unprofessional,unorganized and not very helpful in preparing students for exams, quizzes, assignments etc. She will not respond to emails and changes due dates at any given moment. I feel like I am teaching myself and if I wanted that then I could have taken an online course instead.

WORST TEACHER EVER. I would avoid taking her class at all costs. She is very rude and condescending and punishes people like they are still in high school. If you are not a teachers pet she will highly dislike you. She seems sweet at first but is one of the rudest teachers/professors I  have ever had.
Classmates helped me a lot. She doesn't tell us when quizzes are and the midterm and final is super hard. But she does care and make sure you remember the vocal.

Very unorganized. Quizzes over reading but they happen sporadically. She gave only fifteen minutes to take the midterm. Also we had a million and one speakers who were helpful, but sad part is they consumed the class and we had little to no time for lecture. Horrible and confusing!!! Avoid at all cost unless absolutely necessary!!!!

Also had her for 2200. She is difficut, but not impossible. Write down all due dates and info for assignments, because she is unorganized and doesn't detail what she is looking for. READ THE BOOK. Just do the readings and you can pass the tests. Guest speakers are invaluable. If you're an average student who is serious about CSH, you'll be fine.

She's not helpful and very unreasonable. She likes to punish people for missing class. Lots of busy work. This class reminds me of high school. Worst class of my college career. Don't take it unless you absolutely have to have it.

One of the worst teachers I've ever had. The midterm was over 16 chapters in the book and she said our study guide "was the book". That was absolutely ridiculous considering the midterm was only 15 questions. Do not take this class unless you are serious about the subject.
